result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Curtis L Pribbenow

records.addlTxt: Bail/bond hearing on November 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Per Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS) violation report, Court orders bench warrant issued. 
If the Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCPS. If the Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCPS is required to enforce conditions of release and the Defendant shall report to DCPS by 10:00 a.m. on the business day following release from jail. All other bail conditions remain set.
DCPS violation report; CT issues $2500 warrant
DCPS violation report; no change, but monitor
Status conference on December 20, 2022 at 09:45 am.
DCPS violation report; no change but monitor

2:24 PM Defendant Curtis L Pribbenow in court.  Attorney Crystal A Vera in court for Curtis L Pribbenow.  Prosecuting attorney Timothy Robert Verhoff in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defn received offer, requesting JT. Address verified.
Status conference on August 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defn requests set over- GRANTED
and returned.

Cash bond is set in the amount of $4,000 (per case). $4,000 previously posted to apply. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or _X_ Random Drug Testing. 
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle. 
- Defendant is to remain at his residence/property at all times except with pre-approval from DCPS for medical appointments, groceries (with verified drive), or verified legal appointments.

NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

11:00 AM Defendant in court with Attorney Crystal A Vera.  Hector Al-Homsi appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DCPS Rob C in court. CT addresses Defn's motion and DCPS violation report. Argument by Defn. Statement by Rob C. Argument by State. Defn responds. CT counsels Defn. CT remove remote breath testing. CT adds "Defn is to remain at his residence/property at all times except with pre-approval from DCPS for medical appointments, groceries (with verified drive), or verified legal appointments." ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN THE SAME.
DCPS Violation Report; Court will address new report at the bail hearing 7/29/22
Bail/bond hearing on July 29, 2022 at 10:45 am.
CT reschedules 7/21 BBH
and returned.
Bail/bond hearing on July 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Cash bond is set in the amount of $4,000 (per case). $4,000 previously posted to apply. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, _X_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or _X_ Random Drug Testing. 
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
Copy of minutes from MI event on 7/13/22 and bond form sent electronically to DCJ.
Court adds DCPS to all outstanding cases with GPS. All previously ordered conditions remain the same.
DCPS referral

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Pre-trial conference on August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
Br 12

09:42 AM Defendant in court with Attorney Crystal A Vera.  Benjamin Wagner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.
Preliminary hearing on June 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

03:49 PM Defendant in court with Attorney Crystal A Vera.  Timothy Robert Verhoff appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties in agreement w/ Dr report. Defn feels that he is competent. CT finds that Defn is competent to proceed. CT will track cases until through PH.
by DHS
for competency exam
Atty Crystal Vera
Zoom
Competency hearing on April 28, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle. 
Trial Judge - Br 12

02:35 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Megan Brodkey.  Hector Al-Homsi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  The Court has reviewed the Complaint, makes a finding of probable cause and  ORDERS A COMPETENCY EVALUATION  pursuant to Wis. Stats. 971.14.  The Dept of Health & Family Services shall examine the defendant's mental competency to proceed. THE REPORT ALREADY PREPARED, AND PENDING A COMPETENCY FINDING, IS SUFFICIENT -- AN ADDITIONAL REPORT NEED NOT BE PREPARED AT THIS TIME.  Competency hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
